page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Out of the 12 squares which we were allocated between Tynemouth and Whitley Bay,9 of them were the North Sea.The land use survey showed us that most of the houses were quite old and were terraced.There was some modern development in Cullercoats Village(flats for the old pensioners) but not much of the original fishing village remains now.The only real links that Cullercoats now has with the sea are the Lifeboat house and the Dove Marine Laboratory,which belongs to Newcastle University. Employment in this area is no longer in the fishing industry.The employment now takes people either into the city centre,Newcastle,or into the amusements and amenities in the area.The majority of people use the highly popular Metro.There is little evidence of minority cultures in this area.
